title: Facebook loophole may have let advertisers discriminate against cancer patients and young mothers
text:
Researchers have discovered a loophole in Facebook's advertising system which could allow employers to discriminate against disabled people, people with sensitive medical conditions and women who might soon become mothers.

A report from the think tank Demos found that the social network made it possible for British advertisers to hide their campaigns from users whose "interests" were associated with cancer, depression and juvenile glaucoma.

Further research by the Telegraph revealed that advertisers could also choose to exclude people whose "interests" were associated with parenthood, motherhood, babies, Crohn's Disease and autism.
